item.title: Mark Zuckerberg says he wants to ‘stay out of partisan politics’
item.description: Just weeks ago, Zuckerberg sat next to Trump at a White House dinner and pledged to invest $600 billion in the U.S. over the next four years.

item.title: Jamie Dimon says Trump’s efficiency drive isn’t enough to avert debt crisis: ‘Like most problems, it’s better to deal with it than let it happen’
item.description: Dimon stressed that only faster growth—unlocked by lighter regulation and freer trade—can restore balance to the U.S.’s debt-to-GDP ratio.

item.title: Self-made millionaire behind $4 billion Skims, Emma Grede says it all began with a cold call to Kris Jenner: ‘I have no imposter syndrome’
item.description: Emma Grede runs multiple businesses with the Kardashian's. In an exclusive interview with Fortune, she reveals that empire can all be traced back to o...

item.title: Billionaire Mike Bloomberg was fired after dedicating 15 years of his career to Salomon Brothers—the next morning, he founded his media empire
item.description: Mike Bloomberg started at Salomon Brothers as a clerk making $9,000 a year, making his way up to partner, before getting the boot. He has no hard feel...

item.title: Oracle’s co-CEO structure will challenge the trope that having two chief executives rarely works
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.
